metadata.title: CVE-2021-27135 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
xterm before Patch #366 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary codeor cause a denial of service (segmentation fault) via a crafted UTF-8combining character sequence.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-27135` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xterm - 322-1ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xterm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '322-1ubuntu1.2').
